sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均有"相等的"之意
means: equal ： 指几个物或事在数目、数量、重量、程度或价值等方面完全相等。
equivalent ： 指几个物或事彼此对等，或者具有同等的价值、效果或意义等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"相称，比得上，与……相比"之意。
means: match ： 指对手之间力量、强度、性能或利益等的较量或竞争。
equal ： 指在数量、价值或程度等方面已完全相等。
rival ： 指某人或某物在和对手竞争中，在能力、质量等方面都能与之相匹敌，都能比得上。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"相同的"之意。
means: same ： 可指相同的人或物，也可指在质量、外表或意义等方面相同，但实际上有差别的事物。
identical ： 着重指人或物等在每细节上都完全相同。
very ： 侧重指完全同一，没有区别。
equal ： 多指在价值等方面相当而不相同的事物。
equivalent ： 主要指有同样价值、效力或意义的两种不同的事物。

word_mean: equal-loudness contour 典型听者认为响度相同的纯音的声压级与频率关系的曲线。

sentence.Network_en: In many respects Asian women see themselves as equal to their men.
sentence.Network_cn: 在很多方面，亚洲女性都认为自己和丈夫是平等的。

sentence.Network_en: They are now trying to compete on an equal footing.

sentence.Network_en: The targets would not be achieved unless other departments showed equal commitment.
sentence.Network_cn: 除非其他部门同样努力，否则这些目标无法达成。

jx.jx_en_mean: the person or thing having the highest status in a group
provided that other factors or circumstances remain the same
jx.jx_cn_mean: 其他因素（或条件）不变，同等条件下

lj.lj_ly: it follows that, other things being equal, the price level will rise.
lj.lj_ls: 所以，在同等条件下，价格水平会上升。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin aequalis, from aequus 'even, level, equal'

encyclopedia.content: equal /ˈiːkwəl/ DJ /'ikwəl/ KK 过去式：equaled 过去分词：equaled 现在分词：equaling 名词复数：equals adj.形容词 1.（大小、数量、价值等）相同的，同样的；相等的 ~ (to sb/sth) 2.（权利、能力、等级、地位等）平等的；同等的 3.（力气、勇气、能力等）相当的；能胜任的；能应付的 ~ to sth formal 4.（效果、效力或作用方面）平衡的，均匀的，平均的；相称的； n.名词 1.的人；相等

entry.def: If two things are equal or if one thing is equal to another, they are the same in size, number, standard, or value.

example.ex: Investors can borrow an amount equal to the property's purchase price.
example.tran: 投资者可以获得与房产购买价格相等的借款额。

example.ex: ...in a population having equal numbers of men and women...
example.tran: 在男女人数相等的人口中

entry.def: If different groups of people have equal rights or are given equal treatment, they have the same rights or are treated the same as each other, however different they are.

example.ex: We will be justly demanding equal rights at work.
example.tran: 我们将要求享有工作中应得的平等权利。

entry.tran: （指人的权利和机会）平等的，均等的
entry.def: If you say that people are equal, you mean that they have or should have the same rights and opportunities as each other.

example.ex: We are equal in every way...
example.tran: 我们在各个方面都是平等的。

example.ex: At any gambling game, everyone is equal.
example.tran: 在任何赌博游戏中，每个人都机会均等。

entry.tran: （能力、地位或权利等）同样的人，相当的人
entry.def: Someone who is your equal has the same ability, status, or rights as you have.

example.ex: She was one of the boys, their equal...
example.tran: 她也是男孩子们中的一员，和他们不相上下。

example.ex: You should have married somebody more your equal.
example.tran: 你本应该和一个更门当户对的人结婚。

entry.def: If someone is equal to a particular job or situation, they have the necessary ability, strength, or courage to deal successfully with it.

example.ex: She was determined that she would be equal to any test the corporation put to them...
example.tran: 她下定决心要成功应对公司对他们的任何考验。

example.ex: The guards were equal to anything.
example.tran: 那些卫兵能够应对任何事情。

entry.def: If something equals a particular number or amount, it is the same as that amount or the equivalent of that amount.

example.ex: 9 percent interest less 7 percent inflation equals 2 percent...
example.tran: 9%的利息减去7%的通货膨胀率等于2%。

example.ex: The average pay rise equalled 1.41 times inflation.
example.tran: 薪水的平均增长幅度是通货膨胀率的1.41倍。

entry.def: To equal something or someone means to be as good or as great as them.

example.ex: The victory equalled Southend's best in history...
example.tran: 那次胜利堪比索森德历史上最漂亮的获胜。

example.ex: No amount of money can equal memories like that.
example.tran: 再多的金钱也比不上那样的记忆。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something has no equal, you think that there is nothing that is as good as them or that reaches the same standard.

example.ex: As a pastor, it can be argued he has no equal...
example.tran: 作为牧师，他可以说是出类拔萃。

example.ex: The film demands attention, and has no equal in cinema history.
example.tran: 那部电影众人瞩目，在电影史上无与伦比。

entry.tran: 如果其他条件不变;如无意外情况发生
entry.def: If you say 'other things being equal' or 'all things being equal' when talking about a possible situation, you mean if nothing unexpected happens or if there are no other factors which affect the situation.

example.ex: Other things being equal, most tenants would prefer single to shared rooms...
example.tran: 如果其他条件不变，大多数房客都愿意住单人间而不会选择与他人同住。

example.ex: All things being equal, should it matter who earns most money?
example.tran: 如果一切不变，谁赚的钱最多有什么关系吗？

means.word_mean: 1. a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
2. be equal to in quality or ability;

sentences.sentence: "Your performance doesn't even touch that of your colleagues"
"Her persistence and ambition only matches that of her parents"

means.word_mean: 3. make equal, uniform, corresponding, or matching;

sentences.sentence: "let's equalize the duties among all employees in this office"
"The company matched the discount policy of its competitors"

means.word_mean: 1. well matched; having the same quantity, value, or measure as another;

sentences.sentence: "all men are equal before the law"
"gave one six blows and the other a like number"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ad加强+equ相等,平均+ate……的→和所需的趋向相等

stems_affixes.value_cn: 稳定的,不变的,[脾气]温和的
stems_affixes.word_buile: equ相等,平均+able……的→[心情]能稳定的
equ相等,平均+al……的→adj.相等的;胜任的n.相等的事务;对手v.等于
ad加强+equ相等,平均+acy状态→[数量]已经加到相等了→够了
equ相等,平均+al……的→adj.相等的;胜任的n.相等的事务;对手v.等于

stems_affixes.value_cn: 同等;平等;相等;等式;等同性
stems_affixes.word_buile: equal[adj.相等的;胜任的n.相等的事务;对手v.等于]+ity表名词→n.同等;平等;相等;等式;等同性
equate[v.同等看待,使相等]+ion表名词→n.[数学]等式,方程式;[with]相等;均衡
equ相等,平均+ity表名词→n.公平,公正
equ平等+anim生命+ity表名词→生命平等→平静
equ相等,平均+al……的→adj.相等的;胜任的n.相等的事务;对手v.等于
equ相等,平均+ate表动词→v.同等看待,使相等

Sentence.sentence: The humanities and STEM subjects should be given equal importance.
Equal education opportunities to all children.
Amazon plants, for instance, hold more than 100 billion metric tons of carbon, equal to 15 years of tailpipe and chimney emissions.
They are generally treated as equals by men.
Countries with the highest scores tend to be clustered in the West, where gender discrimination is against the law, and equal rights are constitutionally enshrined(神圣化).

sentences.en: All men are equal in the eye of law.
He doesn't seem equal to meeting our demands.
sentences.cn: 他似乎不太合乎我们的要求。

sentences.en: Few cars can equal this kind of cars for speed.
sentences.cn: 很少有其他车在速度方面胜过这种车。

sentences.en: So far the rate of production doesn't equal the demand.
sentences.cn: 到目前为止，生产率赶不上需要。

means.word_mean: 同样的人, 相等的数量

sentences.en: The government should regard nationalities as equals.
sentences.cn: 政府对待各民族应一视同仁。

means.word_mean: 能与之比拟的东西, 匹敌者

sentences.en: He's the equal of his brother as far as intelligence is concerned.
sentences.cn: 论智力, 他和他哥哥不相上下。

jushi.english: You should be able to wear my dress since we are of equal height.
jushi.chinese: 咱们的身高相同,你应该能穿我的衣服。

jushi.english: Women are paid the same as men for equal work.
She sought the election under the banner of equal rights.
jushi.chinese: 她打着权利平等的旗号竞选。
